messageBody:
> From: Jason Rogers <jacaetevha@...>
> Subject: Re: JUnit And Static Class Variables In VM - HELP !
>
> What else do you expect to happen with the static class variables.
> There will ever only be one instance of them in the JVM, period.

Bzzt. Wrong, folks!

A static class variable occurs only once per *class*, not once per JVM!

If you happen to load a class twice, such as through two different class loaders,
then you will indeed have two instances of the "same" static class variable. Okay,
in truth what you have is two different classes, but does your code know that?

> Why not reset them to their initial state in your TestCase.setUp().

That is a much more useful suggestion. I say go with that.

My guess is that your test cases depend on one another, and particularly depend on
running in a particular order. If the test cases run in separate class loaders,
though, they might as well all be run by themselves. See if perhaps that is your
problem.

-Steven :)
